text: Greshnevo () is a village in Nekrasovsky District of Yaroslavl Oblast, Russia. Population: 588. (Administration of Yaroslavl Oblast. Statistical Bulletin Information on Municipal Formations, Settlements, and Inhabited Localities of Yaroslavl Oblast as of January 1, 2007). The great Russian poet Nikolay Nekrasov lived here during his childhood. Presently, the village is home to a Nekrasov museum. The village was renamed Nekrasovo in the past, but the original name Greshnevo has been restored since then. ==References== Category:Rural localities in Yaroslavl Oblast
title: Greshnevo, Yaroslavl Oblast
